headline: Easy Chicken Marsala
description: Chicken breasts are sauteed, then braised in Marsala wine and cream with mushrooms and green onion. Chicken Marsala simplified!

video.description: Chicken Marsala simplified! This easy recipe for a classic Italian-American dish is perfect for your next weeknight dinner. Chicken breasts are sautéed, then braised in Marsala wine and cream with mushrooms and green onion.
video.name: How to Make Easy Chicken Marsala

name: Easy Chicken Marsala
recipeIngredient: 4 (6 ounce) skinless, boneless chicken breast halves

recipeInstructions.text: Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Saute chicken in hot oil until cooked through and juices run clear, 15 to 20 minutes.
Add mushrooms and green onions to the pan and saute until soft, then add Marsala wine and bring to a boil.
Continue to boil for 2 to 4 minutes, seasoning with salt and pepper to taste. Stir in cream and milk and simmer until heated through, about 5 minutes.

review.reviewBody: This is my go-to for chicken. So easy and so tasty!
So disappointed. After all the raving reviews, this was so tasteless.
Super fantastic. No wonder there are so many 5 star reviews. It’s too good to be so simple!!
This is fantastic! I've made it 5+ times. The only change is to triple the sauce since we eat it over egg noodles, pasta, or mashed potatoes.

We absolutely loved this recipe! My boyfriend a pickier eater even loved it! I made it exactly as shown but agree with everyone we needed more sauce! It was delicious but had hardly any leftover once finished. Would have been nice over a side dish or even for leftovers the next day. I will definitely make this again but with double the sauce!
Easy and Delicious, I doubled the Recipe and it made ample delicious sauce. I will make it again.
It was so simple yet tasted amazing. I seasoned the chicken beforehand with allpurpose, salt, pepper, garlic and onion powder. Family licked the plates!!!!
Delicious! I substituted marsala with merlot. I added green and red peppers, and substituted heavy cream with milk and butter

Loved it. Added more mushrooms and used Greek yogurt instead of heavy cream. Cooked the onions first, added the chicken which I cut into smaller pieces, sautéed til done, then added the mushrooms. Didn’t have green onions so used regular onions. Also added some Italian seasoning and garlic salt instead of salt, and served over rice. 😋
This recipe is so easy and yummy! I made one alteration: dusted the chicken with flour. I would definitely make this for friends or family, or simply for a quick midweek dinner.

This was delicious and enjoyed by everyone! I did pound thin and dredge the chicken first in flour, garlic and a little salt - sauté in butter and olive oil. Set aside, cook mushrooms, green onion and garlic-add 1 cup Marsala and 8 oz. Heavy cream. Salt and pepper as needed, serve over Angel Hair. So easy!
A husband pleaser
This is a good quick recipe for something delicious. Next time I will use more mushrooms. The sauce is creamy and satisfying.
Did as it said , next time will use chicken broth and other seasonings overall though was good for a quick dinner.

It was all right, but it needed some work. I dredged with flour, salt, and garlic powder and beat it flat with a meat mallet in a ziploc bag. This gives it a more fried texture and a skin to work with. I also seasoned the broth with salt and pepper as it was too bland. Also try and triple the sauce like others had suggested.
Very easy and delicious. I added a little extra cream instead of milk, and substituted sweet onions for the green onions. I love Marsala Sauce, and this recipe will definitely go into my rotation!
Followed recipe pretty close. Added a green pepper. Really liked the sauce.

Wonderful, I doubled the sauce as others suggested. Also pounding the breast to about 1/2". Cooked chicken then set aside to avoid overcooking. Made the sauce as listed with two exceptions. Added tablespoon of minced garlic and used 1 cup of heavy cream leaving out the milk. It was awesome. Thank you for the recipe!
It was delicious-- definitely company worthy!!
I added spinach and a little chicken broth.
Quick , easy, and delicious, instant family classic!
We liked it , I’ll try flowering the chicken next time to compare
I changed the heavy cream for 1/2 and 1//2

Recipe is good. I used rotisserie chicken breasts as a shortcut. Served with rice and broccoli. Would be better with angel hair pasta and zuchini. If you have a chicken in the fridge you always have dinner

Wonderful recipe...I used to make it with veal. I would actually cut the veal off the rib bones (I used to live where they had stock yards) and pound it to thin it out. Chicken is delicious, but veal? A-MAZ-ING! I would also add Italian seasoning to the recipe, but that's preference. (...and my dog got veal rib bones for a week!)

Yes I did 
I added a 1/2 tsp granulated garlic. 
I also let heavy cream thicken.

I made this to feed 7 and turned out fantastic. Used heavy whipping cream but no milk. The chicken made enough juices that I did not need to add broth and even ended up needing to thicken it with a roux but the taste was fantastic. Will make again.
It was very easy and of course I used my own season mix.
I used skinless, boneless chicken thighs and it was great! I didn't change anything else.
Took me 2 1/2 hours to make. I added chicken broth and thickened the sauce because my husband has dysphagia.

Wonderful blend of flavors. I followed advice and browned chicken with green onions, then removed from pan. Then sauteed the mushrooms with marsala, then added some chicken broth, salt, pepper, garlic. After about 5 min I put chicken back in pan and let it sautee covered for about 10 min, then uncovered another 10. Added a bit of cream which evened out & enriched the flavors, making enough for the linguine side dish. Served up with fresh chopped parsely which added freshness and appeal, all so good.
This is a favorite in our house. I do make more of the sauce (1/2 cup). So easy and delicious. Serve on angel hair pasta.
Great recipe! Served with cauliflower rice for an amazing low carb meal.

This recipe is amazing. My husband loved it!
It is very easy to prepare!

love this recipe including the suggestions to increase the sauce. Which we enjoy. I also love mushrooms so increased those a lot. Will consider the suggestions to use half&half or evaporated milk with future recipes. I love to continue to tweek things which can make it better or worse.
First time trying this recipe and found it good but next time will tweak the flavor a bit and add a thickening agent to thicken the sauce a bit more.
I cut up chicken into bite size pieces and sautéed in olive oil for 15 minutes. Doubled the sauce ingredients. Served over garlic pasta. This dish was delicious.
Delicious.
Awful. Leaves out a good deal of instructions. Followed it to the “T” and was floppy and awful. 1.5 Stars. Glad others enjoyed it!
4.11.20 ... https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/24010/easy-chicken-marsala/ ... Good, but I don’t want it as creamy leftovers.

Came out perfectly! I tweaked the recipe a bit. I used a flour dredge . With salt , pepper , garlic powder, onion powder , lil bit of cayenne pepper and paprika. Didn’t fully cook the chicken through in the pan . Set it aside then did the mushrooms etc. returned the chicken to finish cooking with all the other ingredients. I also added thyme while everything was cooking together. I do the same recipe with pork tenderloin cutlets. Awesome dish ! Ohhh. If ya want you can use marshal and Madeira wine together. A little extra sweetness.
Made it per the recipe. Wasn’t bad. Not a lot of flavor.

Very very good. I made as directed and spooned it over some pasta. When I make this again, I will add a bit more seasoning like onion and garlic and flour the chicken and sauté it in some olive oil. Otherwise it’s great and so much easier than how I’ve always made it.
Not so good. Sauce was very thin and lacking flavor
This was a great dish I was able to find all the ingredients very easy. Went straight by the recipe and it turned out great.

Made this for dinner tonight. Followed some suggestions for more sauce. Used evaporated milk instead of cream to keep down the fat. Unfortunately the sauce split badly. I removed the chicken and used an immersion blender to pulverize it. The flavor was good but I think next time I will just stop at the wine step and call it a day.
It was really good. Quick. Easy. I felt like the Marsala sauce was a little weak. Made angel hair pasta to go with it.
It was very easy and delicious!!!
This was great, I used chicken thighs because that’s what
We didnt like it at all. We've had chicken marsala in italian restaurants but they tasted nothing like this.
This is good! I doubled the wine, cream, and milk because we like a lot of sauce. Served over pasta.
Another winner! This dish was so easy to make, and it is delicious!
I loved this dish! Very simple to make, plus it is keto friendly!! I did tweak it a little. I used chicken thighs and I added curry and parsley! Will definitely make it again.
I added a couple of sprigs of thyme and it smelled super good.
Easy recipe. Added rosemary, parsley, and spinach.
This was great! I added asparagus, cut into 3 cm lengths, and parboiled for 10 minutes.

Excellent recipe. I used 1/2 cup sweet onion rather than the green onion, 1 cup marsala wine, 1 cup evaporated milk instead of the heavy cream, and took the chickeon out of the pan while cooking the sauce. Thanks to the recipe author and all those who provided reviews for substitutions!
yummy this was so good
Great!
The recipe is very easy to make and is delicious. I didn't have any Marsala wine so I used a Moscato and it was awesome!

I make this often using canola oil or peanut oil. I like conola as it is heart healthy too. It is ez to change this rescipe adding other vegetables like frozen baby peas to it ar last minute to heat thru. Will try using bacon will be good too. Dredging chicken in flour garlic and salt n pepper is good as it will thicken the sauce a little for gravy but it is optional. Making sure chicken pieces are the same size saves on pounding them to make cooking uniform. I have added fresh basil, thyme and each is really good in this rescipe.
Really good, but I think I'll thicken the sauce a little next time.

Season chicken with salt and pepper, then dredge chicken in 1/4 cup flour with 1/2 teaspoon garlic power and cook in 1 tablespoon olive oil and 1 tablespoon butter. Remove chicken from pan and add a little more olive oil and saute mushrooms with a little garlic. Add chicken back to pan and add marsala and cream.

An easy and delicious meal. I grabbed sweet Marsala wine AFTER reading the recipie & thought I'd screw this up, but it worked out just as well, if not better. Did not use sherry, or cream or milk either. The sauce came out excellent, and I read lots of other recipies from other sites before attempting this. I made Chicken Marsala a long time ago, and for the life of me could not remember what I did, but it did turn out great. I used 2 cans of mushrooms, drained, and also two tablespoons of bottled minced garlic, plus I diced a medium onion and sautéed all of it in the same pan after doing the chicken. DO NOT OMIT flouring and frying the chicken--I feel this is key. I also seasoned the flour with dried Italian seasonings that you can pick up at any grocery store, along with salt and pepper. DId not season the chicken, since I seasoned the flour, and the whole meal came out excellent. I served it over spaghetti, and you want to make sure you have enough sauce. I ended up using the ENTIRE bottle of Marsala wine for 6 chicken breasts, along with a can of chicken broth. Again, I omitted the cream and milk and sherry and it was restaurant quality.

Used a rotisserie chicken & lots of Marsala (~a cup)
Really good!

Easy - yes - but needed to add some butter/olive oil, 1T of cornstarch to thicken and some marjoram & garlic powder. Original seemed bland and a little watery. No disrespect to OP at all - just prefer a bit more flavor.

This is a keeper! Even my Italian girlfriend was impressed with the recipe. I tweaked it a little bit though. Here's what I did: I cooked the chicken first and set it aside (I didn't want to over cook it); I doubled the sauce (heavy cream, wine, and milk); added a few dashes of oregano, and added a few teaspoons of grated parmesan cheese. Once the 'shrooms and green onions were cooked and the sauce was reduced a bit I added the chicken back to the pan. Great recipe. Thanks!
Pretty good base recipe.
This was so easy to make and very delicious. I will be making this again.

It's great for a week night dinner and didn't have time to dredge in flour mixture as some suggested. Instead of pounding down the chicken breast, I used thighs instead. Used chopped yellow onions and sautéed it in half olive oil and couple of tablespoons of butter, then added sliced mushrooms and a little dried oregano, s&p. Used 1/2C of Marsala wine, cooked & reduced for about 4 min, and then added the 1/3C heavy cream and 1/8C 1% milk, and simmered for 5 min. Definitely will make again!
Doubled the wine and only used a splash of cream. Added crushed garlic, used red onion because that's what I had. Very easy and tasty. Served with angel hair. Will definitely make again.
I only like Chicken Marsala from 2 restaurants....this recipe is right up there with my 2 favorite Italian restaurants! I Loved it and will Definitely make again and again!
That was an easy recipe. It was also delicious. The children cleaned their plates.
This was very good however next time I would at least double the sauce portion.

Yum! Yum! Such a great recipe. I seasoned my chicken before sauteing them. The amount of cream and milk should be adjusted if you prefer a darker marsala as opposed to a lighter one. You will have to spot. I suggest mixing the milk and cream together and only putting half in at a time. I serve this with pasta (plenty of gravy) and veggies. It was a delight.
I cut in half each chicken and pounded them flat. Used sweet onion and chives instead of green onions (I didn't have any). Added slightly more Marsala wine and 1/2 and 1/2. Very good and fast!
I hated it sadly.

I'm not a wonderful cook, but I know my way around the kitchen. This was a very simple recipe that didn't require many ingredients and turned out pretty tasty! I added garlic powder to the chicken before sautéing for some added flavor while also seasoning it with additional salt and pepper. The only change I would make is to I up the portions for the sauce just a bit. I served this over pasta and the recipe didn't yield quite enough sauce to coat the pasta. Otherwise, great recipe and I'll cook it again.
I used coconut milk which definitely made the sauce creamier.
Easy peasy! If the instructions were more broken up, it would be more clear, but even screwing up the order of operations, it turned out very good.

Delicious! The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is because I think it needs quite a bit more sauce. I modified the recipe a bit...After the chicken breasts were sautéed and cooked thoroughly , I removed them and set aside. I then sautéed the mushrooms and scallions in the same skillet, in about a tsp. of butter, before adding the wine and cream. I served over Garlic and Parsley fettuccini. It was a big hit!
I am not a good cook. I mess up a lot of recipes. I successfully made this and was so impressed with myself that i 'boasted ' on FB. I never did that before - not a big FB person. GO FOR IT!
This was just right. The color was off I think it needed to be pan fried in butter after a flour coating
Loved this recipe - the only change I made was to dredge the chicken in flour with a little proper & oregano first.
I've made this a couple different times with and without mushrooms. I have a very picky niece who loved it. I couldn't have asked for a better and easy recipe for family dinner night!
I made this and it was a huge hit. I love the simplicity of the recipe and the great taste. Definitely a keeper.
Delicious and easy!! I didn't have the mushrooms but I had peppers I needed to use up so I substituted. And I didn't have Marsala wine all I had was white wine. It was awesome and quick
Super easy made me look like a chef!!

I feel guilty leaving this review, but I do it so I can remember what I've made. I did not have heavy cream or Marsala wine, so I did substitutions and that probably changed the test. It was good but not great, will try and make again with the exact ingredients it calls for.
Delicious, but I added extra marsala...yum!
Very easy and delicious! As many others have done I made triple the sauce so that there would be plenty to have with rice.
Excellent recipe, quick and easy. I omitted the onion only because I forgot to buy them and it still tasted great.

This was delicious. 
I followed the advice of one reviewer who dredged the chicken with flour, and pounded it in a plastic bag to tenderize it before cooking.
I also removed the chicken from the sauté pan while cooking the mushrooms and making the sauce so as not to over-cook the chicken.
The sauce was delicious, and you won't be sorry if you double (or triple!) the amount.
Awesome recipe, very easy to make and delicious!

Made this recipe for the first time and it was ok found that cooking the chicken until done then adding the wine and cream at the end made the chicken kinda dry and overcooked by the time the sauce thickened up to my liking but i reheated the leftovers the next day and after sitting in sauce overnight it was better then when it was first done
Make twice the sauce. May need to thicken a little with flour.

Is it impossible to make an easy gourmet dinner in a flash during the weekday? Not with this recipe!!! Wow! That is all I have to say. Again, I am a purist and usually do the recipes as they are written the first time around. The recipe was definitely very good as is and deserves all the stars. If and only if you decide to “augment” it, here are my suggestions:
1- Lightly dredge the chicken in flour before sautéing it. It gives it a little crust which I like.
2- Remove the chicken from the skillet and reserve in a plate before step #2, and only put back the chicken after adding the cream in step #3. This will ensure that the chicken is still tender.
3- Triple the sauce (i.e. 1 cup of Marsala and 1 cup of cream)!!! It is the best attribute of the recipe! Since there will already be a lot of cream, you don’t need the milk. I just omit it now.
4- Make sure you take the time to cook down the Marsala wine, which is why it should be boiled for 2 to 4 minutes as per step #3. Marsala is a nice fortified wine but can be a little overpowering for kids and people that don’t especially appreciate alcohol.
That being said, I’ve served this over pasta, rice, and mashed vegetables and I’ve only had rave reviews.
Thanks Sal!

Loved this but this time I had two surprise guests for dinner....4 breast, 6 diners. I improvised by cutting the chicken into good size pieces without pounding it thinly and followed the directions except tripled the sauce. I served over mashed and it was filling, stretched great and all were full. Only did 1/2 and1/2 and it was delish!

I made this following one of the suggestions of subbing evap. milk in place of the cream and increasing the marsala. This recipe was far too sweet for my likes and lacked flavor and I was disappointed in it. My modifications would be to add fresh garlic cloves and to lower the sweetness somehow...?adding chicken broth and balance out some of the sweetness from the marsala or the milk.
